attributes.text:
Low-level Rich text editor which can be used by connecting it to an existing DOM element (DIV node). This component does not contain any {@link qx.ui} code resulting in a smaller footprint.

Optimized for the use at a traditional webpage.
DOM element to connect the component to
Optional style information for the editor’s document Can be a string or a map (example: { “p” : “padding:2px” }

This event is dispatched when the editor gets a right click.

Fires a data event with the following data:

  • x – absolute x coordinate
    * y – absolute y coordinate
    * relX – relative x coordinate
    * relY – relative y coordinate
    * target – DOM element target

This event holds a data map which informs about the formatting at the current cursor position. It holds the following keys:

  • bold
  • italic
  • underline
  • strikethrough
  • fontSize
  • fontFamily
  • insertUnorderedList
  • insertOrderedList
  • justifyLeft
  • justifyCenter
  • justifyRight
  • justifyFull

This map can be used to control/update a toolbar states.
This event is dispatched when the editor gets the focus and his own handling is done
This event is dispatched when the document receives an “focusout” event
Thrown when the editor gets an error at loading time.
Only available if messengerMode is active. This event returns the current content of the editor.
This event is dispatched when the editor is ready to use
This event is dispatched when the editor is ready to use after it was re-located and re-initialized. Only implemented for Gecko browsers.

Holds information about the state of undo/redo Keys are “undo” and “redo”. Possible values are 0 and -1 to stay in sync with the kind the “cursorContext” event works. (1 = active/pressed, 0 = possible/not pressed, -1 = disabled)
CSS styles which should be applied at startup of the editor
Formats the style information. If the styleInformation was passed in as a map it gets converted to a string.
Controls whether the root node is also added to the output
whether the html encoding of text nodes should be skipped
optional function to call which is executed with every element processing
Checks if given element needs a closing tag
String that contain valid style informations separated by ”;”

Parse style string to map.

Example: qx.bom.htmlarea.HtmlArea.__parseStyle(“text-align: left; text-weight: bold;”);
Map of style names and it’s values
Checks if the given node is a block node
Checks of the given node is headline node.
Checks if one element is in the list of elements that are allowed to contain a paragraph in HTML
Add key event listeners to the body element
Helper method which checks if content is available and if not sets the default content.
Create a “DIV” element which can be added to the document. This element is the container for the editable iframe element.
Returns a range for the current selection
Range object or null if the document is not available
Helper method to create an object which acts like a command manager instance to collect all commands which are executed BEFORE the command manager instance is ready.

Examines the current context of the cursor (e.g. over bold text). This method will dispatch the data event “cursorContext” which holds a map with different keys like bold, italic, underline etc. The main purpose for this event is to be able to set the states of your toolbar buttons so you can e.g. visualize that the cursor is currently over bold text.

The possible values are -1 = command is not possible at the moment. Used to disable the corresponding buttons 0 = command is possible at the moment. Used to enable the corresponding buttons (e.g. bold/italic/underline etc.) 1 = cursor is over content which already received that command. Used to to activate the corresponding buttons (e.g. bold/italic/underline etc.)
string to insert into the default content
Generates the default content and inserts the given string
Returns the document skeleton with content usable for the editor
Returns the CSS styles which should be exported as a CSS string. This prevents that styles which are only for internal use appear in the result (e.g. overflow settings).
CSS string of body styles to export
Returns style attribute as string of a given element
Browser-specific implementation to get the current range contents
Initial content which is written dynamically into the iframe’s document
Helper function which inserts an linebreak at the selection.

Check the selection focus node if it’s an element. Used a paragraph handling – if the focus node is an element it’s not necessary to intercept the paragraph handling.

ATTENTION: Currently only implemented for Gecko
Checks if the cursor is within a word boundary. ATTENTION: Currently only implemented for Gecko
Process the stacked commands if available. This feature is necessary at startup when the command manager is yet not ready to execute the commands after the initialization.
Opens a new document and sets the content (if available)

Called when the iframes is loaded and the HtmlArea is in the “invalid” state. Re-initializes the HtmlArea and fires the {@link qx.bom.htmlarea.HtmlArea#readyAfterInvalid} event to offer a time moment for the application developer to execute commands after the re-location.

Only implemented for Gecko browser.
Resets the content and selects the default focus node
Set or unset the design mode on the current document
Wrapper method to examine the current context
should be removed if someone find a better way to ensure that the document is ready in IE6
Cleaning up a given word (removing HTML code)
Creates an iframe element with the given URI and adds it to the container element.
element to retrieve all text nodes from
*** IN DEVELOPMENT! *** Helper method for returning all text nodes

If the property {@link nativeContextMenu} is set to false this handler method stops the browser from displaying the native context menu and fires an own event for the application developers to position their own (qooxdoo) contextmenu.

Fires a data event with the following data:

  • x – absolute x coordinate
    * y – absolute y coordinate
    * relX – relative x coordinate
    * relY – relative y coordinate
    * target – DOM element target

Otherwise the native browser contextmenu is shown as usual.
All keyPress events are delegated to this method
All keyUp events are delegated to this method
Eventlistener for all mouse events. This method is invoked for mshtml on “click” events and on “mouseup” events for all others.
Checks if the user has performed a selection and released the mouse button outside of the editor. If so the body element is re-activated to receive the keypress events correctly.

Initializes the command manager, sets the document editable, renders the content and adds a needed event listeners when the document is ready for it. After the successful startup the “ready” event is thrown.
Convenient function to select an element. The “set” method of qx.bom.Selection is not sufficient here. It does select the element, but does not show the caret.
Can be used to set the user focus to the content. Also used when the “TAB” key is used to tab into the component. This method is also called by the {@link qx.ui.embed.HtmlArea} widget.
Returns the complete content of the editor
whether the html encoding of text nodes should be skipped

Getting the computed value of the editor. This method returns the current value of the editor traversing the elements below the body element. With this method you always get the current value, but it is much more expensive. So use it carefully.

Returns the (computed) value of the property contentType.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #contentType}.
Returns the information about the current context (focusNode). It’s a map with information about “bold”, “italic”, “underline”, etc.

Returns the (computed) value of the property defaultFontFamily.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #defaultFontFamily}.

Returns the (computed) value of the property defaultFontSize.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #defaultFontSize}.
Whether the document is in editable mode
Returns the node where the selection ends
Focus node or null if no range is available
whether the html encoding of text nodes should be skipped
current content of the editor as XHTML
Returns the iframe object which is used to render the content

Returns the (computed) value of the property insertLinebreakOnCtrlEnter.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #insertLinebreakOnCtrlEnter}.

Returns the (computed) value of the property insertParagraphOnLinebreak.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #insertParagraphOnLinebreak}.

Returns the (computed) value of the property messengerMode.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #messengerMode}.

Returns the (computed) value of the property nativeContextMenu.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #nativeContextMenu}.

Returns the (computed) value of the property postProcess.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #postProcess}.
Returns the range of the current selection
Returns the content of the actual range as text
*** IN DEVELOPMENT! *** Returns all text nodes

Returns the (computed) value of the property useUndoRedo.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #useUndoRedo}.

Getting the value of the editor. Attention: The content of the editor is synced at focus/blur events, but not on every input. This method is not delivering the current content in a stable manner. To get the current value of the editor use the {@link #getComputedValue} method instead.
the node element where the text should be retrieved from.
Returns all the words that are contained in a node.

Calls the apply method and dispatches the change event of the property contentType with the default value defined by the class developer. This function can only be called from the constructor of a class.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #contentType}.

Calls the apply method and dispatches the change event of the property defaultFontFamily with the default value defined by the class developer. This function can only be called from the constructor of a class.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #defaultFontFamily}.

Calls the apply method and dispatches the change event of the property defaultFontSize with the default value defined by the class developer. This function can only be called from the constructor of a class.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #defaultFontSize}.

Calls the apply method and dispatches the change event of the property insertLinebreakOnCtrlEnter with the default value defined by the class developer. This function can only be called from the constructor of a class.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #insertLinebreakOnCtrlEnter}.

Calls the apply method and dispatches the change event of the property insertParagraphOnLinebreak with the default value defined by the class developer. This function can only be called from the constructor of a class.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #insertParagraphOnLinebreak}.

Calls the apply method and dispatches the change event of the property messengerMode with the default value defined by the class developer. This function can only be called from the constructor of a class.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #messengerMode}.

Calls the apply method and dispatches the change event of the property nativeContextMenu with the default value defined by the class developer. This function can only be called from the constructor of a class.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #nativeContextMenu}.

Calls the apply method and dispatches the change event of the property postProcess with the default value defined by the class developer. This function can only be called from the constructor of a class.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #postProcess}.

Calls the apply method and dispatches the change event of the property useUndoRedo with the default value defined by the class developer. This function can only be called from the constructor of a class.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #useUndoRedo}.
Inserts html content on the current selection
URL for the image to be inserted

Sets the editor for all gecko browsers into the state “invalid” to be able to re-initialize the editor with the next load of the iframe.

This “invalid” state is necessary whenever the whole HtmlArea high-level widget is moved around to another container.

Only implemented for Gecko browser.
Whether the document is in editable mode

Check whether the (computed) value of the boolean property insertLinebreakOnCtrlEnter equals true.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #insertLinebreakOnCtrlEnter}.

Check whether the (computed) value of the boolean property insertParagraphOnLinebreak equals true.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #insertParagraphOnLinebreak}.
Service method to check if the component is already loaded. Overrides the base method.

Check whether the (computed) value of the boolean property messengerMode equals true.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #messengerMode}.

Check whether the (computed) value of the boolean property nativeContextMenu equals true.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #nativeContextMenu}.
Whether the editor is ready to accept commands etc.

Check whether the (computed) value of the boolean property useUndoRedo equals true.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #useUndoRedo}.
Removes all formatting styles on the current selection content

Resets the user value of the property contentType.

The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depeneding on the property configuration and value availability.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #contentType}.

Resets the user value of the property defaultFontFamily.

The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depeneding on the property configuration and value availability.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #defaultFontFamily}.

Resets the user value of the property defaultFontSize.

The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depeneding on the property configuration and value availability.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #defaultFontSize}.

The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depeneding on the property configuration and value availability.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #insertLinebreakOnCtrlEnter}.

The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depeneding on the property configuration and value availability.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #insertParagraphOnLinebreak}.

The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depeneding on the property configuration and value availability.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #messengerMode}.

The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depeneding on the property configuration and value availability.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #nativeContextMenu}.

The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depeneding on the property configuration and value availability.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #postProcess}.

The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depeneding on the property configuration and value availability.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #useUndoRedo}.

Saves the current range to let the next command operate on this range. Currently only interesting for IE browsers, since they loose the range / selection whenever an element is clicked which need to have a focus (e.g. a textfield widget).

NOTE: the next executed command will reset this range.
Sets the background color of the editor
url of the background image to set
repeat mode. Possible values are “repeat|repeat-x|repeat-y|no-repeat”. Default value is “no-repeat”

Position of the background image. Possible values are ”|top|bottom|center|left|right|right top|left top|left bottom|right bottom” or an array consisting of two values for x and y coordinate. Both values have to define the unit e.g. “px” or ”%”. Default value is “top”
Sets the current selection content to bold font style

Sets the user value of the property contentType.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #contentType}.

Sets the user value of the property defaultFontFamily.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #defaultFontFamily}.

Sets the user value of the property defaultFontSize.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #defaultFontSize}.
Whether the document is in editable mode
Sets the current selection content to the specified font family
Sets the current selection content to the specified font size

Sets the user value of the property insertLinebreakOnCtrlEnter.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #insertLinebreakOnCtrlEnter}.

Sets the user value of the property insertParagraphOnLinebreak.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #insertParagraphOnLinebreak}.
Sets the current selection content to italic font style

Sets the user value of the property messengerMode.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #messengerMode}.

Sets the user value of the property nativeContextMenu.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #nativeContextMenu}.

Sets the user value of the property postProcess.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #postProcess}.
Sets the current selection content to strikethrough font style
Sets the current selection content to the specified background color
Sets the current selection content to the specified font color
Sets the current selection content to underline font style

Sets the user value of the property useUndoRedo.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #useUndoRedo}.

Toggles the (computed) value of the boolean property insertLinebreakOnCtrlEnter.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #insertLinebreakOnCtrlEnter}.

Toggles the (computed) value of the boolean property insertParagraphOnLinebreak.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #insertParagraphOnLinebreak}.

Toggles the (computed) value of the boolean property messengerMode.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #messengerMode}.

Toggles the (computed) value of the boolean property nativeContextMenu.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #nativeContextMenu}.

Toggles the (computed) value of the boolean property useUndoRedo.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #useUndoRedo}.
Selected content type. Currently only XHTML is supported.
Default font family to use when e.g. user removes all content
Default font size to use when e.g. user removes all content
If true we add a linebreak after control+enter
Toggles whether a p element is inserted on each line break or not. A “normal” linebreak can be achieved using the combination “Shift+Enter” anyway
If turned on the editor acts like a messenger widget e.g. if one hits the Enter key the current content gets outputted (via a DataEvent) and the editor clears his content
Whether to use the native contextmenu or to block it and use own event
Function to use in postProcessing html. See getHtml() and __getHtml().
